Link Mash (September 18, 2014),

Sep 18, 2014
3 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • iOS8review. Federico provides the best overall coverage of the iOS 8 release.
  • axiak/fuzzyset. A Python library to do fuzzy text matching. Cool!
  • GIF YouTube.. If Giphy isn’t getting the job done, this tool allows you to make your own GIFs from YouTube videos. (via Brett Terpstra)
  • What’s New in Drafts 4 (Quick Draft). “Here’s a first go at a ‘What’s New in Drafts 4’ list for existing users.” LOOK AT THIS LIST.
  • keedreams/keen. Commander Keen was a huge part of my childhood. Can’t wait to check this out. (via Tim Hopper).
  • EricChiang/pup. HTML parsing is hard; you know that, right? This is a great tool to overcome those difficulties.
  • Animated Algorithms. Animated representations of algorithms are older than time itself, but still, this is a pretty cool representation.
  • Never Forget Your Umbrella Again, With Huginn. Huginn — an open source project that aims to be an open, private IFTTT/Zapier/Yahoo! Pipes/etc. — is one of those projects that I’ve wanted to implement, yet struggled to. This article (and its two follow up articles, here and here) might just get me over the hump.
  • Induction – A Polyglot Database Client For Mac OS X. An interesting data visualization tool for a variety of data sources.
  • ImageOptim. If you deal with images on OS X at all, you need this.
  • The Ultimate Smart iTunes Playlist. I’m more of a Spotify man these days, but back in the day, my “Smart Radio” iTunes playlist — which contained a mix of new stuff, rare stuff, and favorites (all weighted correctly), while simultaneously leaving out the stuff that I didn’t care for — was the best thing on earth. This article was where it all started.
  • Automatically Log Work Hours with IFTTT. Nathan Henrie is an automation king in my book. Here’s a great workflow of his: using IFTTT location triggers to automatically track his work day in a Google Spreadsheet.
  • vinta/awesome-python. I’m sure I’m late to the ball with this one, but oh my, what an amazing list of Python libraries. Can’t wait to test some ideas out in Pythonista.
  • The iOS @@ shortcut is so useful, you’ll never use your iPhone the same way again. I already have email address text expansion snippets, but these are too appetizing not to try.
  • Refining The Way We Structure Our CSS At Trello. If you’ve ever wondered about the newest techniques in modern CSS, this is a great article explaining how Trello does it.
  • PopKey | Animated GIF keyboard.. OH EM GEE. When it comes out in the States, I bet I spend the majority of my time in this keyboard.
  • worldveil/dejavu. Is it twisted of me that I want to somehow incorporate this sweet Python audio recognition library into Pythonista?
  • Convert various text file formats in the OS X Terminal with textutil. I’m constantly surprised at the little utilities that OS X contains by default. This is another one.
  • The Perfect Web Development Environment for Your New Mac. In my previous life as a web developer, I had a setup similar to this – great set of ideas to make a development environment work much more cleanly.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.
